perturbation.original_text: Grantor hereby grants to Grantee and Grantee hereby accepts a franchise to construct, reconstruct, operate, maintain, repair, and extend a Gas Distribution System within Grantor's Territorial Limits in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth below ("Franchise"). The Franchise is granted pursuant to Grantor's Franchise Ordinance (Ordinance No. 967), adopted November 17, 2015, ("Ordinance"), which is incorporated by reference herein, including any applicable definitions.
perturbation.changed_text: Grantor grants to Grantee a franchise to construct a Gas Distribution System within Grantor's Territorial Limits in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth below ("Franchise"). The Grantee may or may not accept the stated Franchise based on their discretion. The Franchise is granted pursuant to Grantor's Franchise Ordinance (Ordinance No. 967), adopted November 17, 2015, ("Ordinance"), which is not binding.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Grantor grants and the Grantee accepts the franchise. The modified text introduces uncertainty by stating the Grantee may or may not accept, contradicting the initial grant, and the 'Ordinance' is not binding, which means the term is not certain. This creates doubt as to whether a valid agreement exists.

perturbation.original_text: Grantee shall pay to Grantor a Franchise Fee which shall be calculated pursuant to this Section. It is understood that Grantee has or will enter into franchise agreements with the City of Roanoke ("Roanoke") and the City of Salem ("Salem") and the Town of Vinton ("Vinton") (Grantor, Roanoke and Salem being hereinafter sometimes collectively referred to as the "localities" and singularly as a "locality") with fee provisions identical to this one, and that the total annual Franchise Fee to be paid to the three localities in aggregate is $98,196 for calendar year 2016 ("base year total annual Franchise Fee").
perturbation.changed_text: Grantee may pay to Grantor a Franchise Fee which may be calculated pursuant to this Section. It is understood that Grantee has or will enter into franchise agreements with the City of Roanoke ("Roanoke") and the City of Salem ("Salem") and the Town of Vinton ("Vinton") (Grantor, Roanoke and Salem being hereinafter sometimes collectively referred to as the "localities" and singularly as a "locality") with fee provisions identical to this one, but the total annual Franchise Fee to be paid to the three localities in aggregate may be something else for calendar year 2016 ("base year total annual Franchise Fee").
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a clear obligation and specific calculation method for the franchise fee, setting a concrete financial term. The modified text introduces uncertainty regarding both the obligation to pay (using 'may pay') and the calculation method (using 'may be calculated'). It also questions the specific annual fee amount by suggesting it 'may be something else,' directly contradicting the fixed value of $98,196. This undermines the financial certainty of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least forty (40) hours per week for the conduct of business between Grantee and its customers.
perturbation.changed_text: Grantee may or may not during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the Territorial Limits of Grantor. The office shall be opened when the Grantee want it to be opened.
perturbation.explanation: The original text dictates that the Grantee shall maintain one office, and such office shall be opened for at least forty hours per week. The modified text introduces uncertainty, using 'may or may not' contradicting the original statement. Additionally, it says the 'office shall be opened when the Grantee want it to be opened' is a contradiction to the 40 hours stated in the original.
